content: @Darkrentin, could you please add cover art? I'd volunteer if you don't have time.

"Divide b by the remainder of the division of b by a and continue until you get r=0." 

==>

"Divide b by the remainder of the division of a by b and continue until you get r=0."

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Indispensable for the arithmetic course!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very clear and very easy to understand. Might need a bit of math knowledge but not that much.

Great puzzle! For me, learning Euclid's algorithm was an impactful moment in my education that I will probably never forget and your puzzle is a nice complement to that learning process.

May I have your permission to do some minor grammatical and formatting edits? I will not change any of your test cases or the overall structure of your puzzle. It is well done as is. I find it is easier to ask permission for minor edits than to write the suggestions all out and go back and forth. You can take a snapshot and veto anything I change if you wish. i.e. A couple of capitalization mistakes, using "greatest common divisor" alongside the first use of "GCD" instead of the third use of "GCD", etc.

I do have one suggestion that is purely aesthetic. How about naming your test cases according to the division being done. i.e. Instead of "Test 1", the name could be "25 / 3". Obviously, that is purely superficial, but you have a great puzzle and I'd like to see it present visually as well as possible!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I liked solving this puzzle.
All the testcases behaved as expected and my solution was accepted.
I don't recall seeing puzzle asking me to implement Euclid's Algorithm on this site before. I didn't have any problems understanding the assignment after reading the description and also i didn't find any errors.
A useful aid for the math class!

Input section
* Please state that the integers are separated by a space.

Constraints section
* Please add the constraint of [[a]], [[b]] > 0.

Thanks.
thank you for your suggestions! I changed some stuff.
